properties.areaDesc: Lauderdale, TN; Dyer, TN; Pemiscot, MO; Lake, TN; Mississippi, AR
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 2 at 6:43PM CST until January 16 at 4:00PM CST by NWS Memphis TN
properties.description:
The Flood Warning continues for the Mississippi River.

The Flood Warning continues for
the Mississippi River at Caruthersville
* from Sunday January 5 until Wednesday January 15.
* At 6 PM Thursday the stage was 27.9 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Maximum forecast stage of 33.5 feet on Tuesday January 7.
* Flood stage is 32.0 feet.
* Forecast to rise above flood stage by Sunday January 5 and
continue to rise to near 33.5 feet by Tuesday January 7. The river
will fall below flood stage by Wednesday January 15.
* At 34.0 feet...In Tennessee, Barr Road along the Middle Fork of the
Forked Deer River is flooding near the bridge at the south end of
Watkins Road. Water from the north bottom of Lauderdale County is
now flowing over the basin boundary into the south bottomm of
Lauderdale County. In Missouri, large business just north of
Caruthersville is beginning to flood. Many fields adjacent to the
Interstate 155 bridge are flooded.
properties.instruction:
A followup Flood Statement will be issued Friday or sooner if
conditions warrant.

For graphical river and flood information...please go to
www.weather.gov and click near Memphis on the map, then select Rivers
and Lakes.

Do not drive through flooded areas...turn around don't drown.

Stay tuned to your weather radio and your local news media for the
latest river information.
